data.title: "translate python" variables not set when entering replay
data.body:
``` renpy
define regular_var = "Regularly defined variable."

translate None python:
    tl_var = "Translation-specific variable."

label start:

    "[regular_var]"
    "[tl_var]"

    $ renpy.call_replay("test_replay")

    "Replay over."

    return

label test_replay:

    "Starting replay."
    "[regular_var]"
    "[tl_var]"

    $ renpy.end_replay()
```

On entering replay mode, `tl_var` is undefined and will cause an error.

data.title: _image_load_log screen fills the window
data.body: Rather than only taking up as much space as it needs, when shown, the _image_load_log screen now fills the entire window at all times in 6.99.11

data.title: interruption when starting audio playback in Android
data.body:
App will pause ~0.2 seconds when audio is played.  This includes an interruption in audio being played in a separate channel.

Tested with 6.99.11, Android 5.1.1

data.title: Fix some typos in config documentation
data.body: Fix some spelling errors. Plus, I'm pretty sure hertz (the unit) is written as Hz, since it is named after Hertz (the person).

data.title: SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print' when try build renpy with python3
data.body:
rev 67a6241

`RENPY_CYTHON=cython python module/setup.py build`

```
  File "module/setup.py", line 238
    print "Warning: Did not include fribidi."
                                            ^
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'

```

python3: 3.5.2

data.title: macOS Sierra Plan
data.body:
**Ren'Py SDK**

There will be a main distribution that is a signed DMG containing the Ren'Py folder. If Ren'Py is run from the DMG, we'll prompt the user to move it to a read-write folder. We should sign the mac app and move as many dylibs as possible into it.

**Ren'Py Games**

Get rid of the -all package. Replace it with a windows/linux pc package, and a -mac app package. Optionally allow the mac app to be signed, and to be bundled as a signed DMG instead of a .zip.

data.title: Editra fails to launch in 6.99.11
data.body:
Ren'Py Version:  renpy-6.99.11-sdk
OS:  Windows 8

Story:  I went to use this version of Ren'Py for the first time and it prompted me to download Editra; I did and tried to edit my script.  It gave me the screenshot attached.  The editor never popped up.

![error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21211342/17917306/c239ab5e-6980-11e6-8764-7c316652c940.png)

Then I tried manually starting Editra from the .exe in the file.  Nothing.  Not even an error message.  

Then I tried deleting the whole 'Editra' folder to see if Ren'Py would redownload it, but when I tried to edit a script it just said that it couldn't find the file it needed.

data.title: game window size bigger than expacted
data.body:
os: win10  &  win7
latpop screen resolution: 1920 \* 1080
game resolution: 1280 \* 720

however, game in window will not be exactly the size that 720p will be in 1080p. In fact, the actual game window size is roughly 125% bigger than normal 720p as is shown in figure below.
But i don't know the exact size because i don't measure it.

In the figure, the screen is 1920*1080, the red rectangle is 1280 \* 720 as a wallpaper, the actual game window is bigger than the red rectangle.

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12960298/17853572/ef2f2238-689f-11e6-9bf9-632116567bff.png)

data.title: renpy.game.script.namemap.value stores wrong directory
data.body:
A lookup of the namemap returns invalid files (unless renpy is run from the game directory):

`filename = renpy.game.script.namemap.get(renpy.game.context().current, None).filename`

The returned filename is relative to the current working directory, which appears to be a bug. The .linenumber is correct. A workaround to get to the .rpy file that works for me is the following:

`filename = re.sub(os.getcwd() + "(.*)c$", config.searchpath[0] + "\g<1>", filename)`

And it also seems that the valid .rpy is contained in renpy.game.context().current[0]

(running on Arch Linux  4.6.4-1 x86_64 with renpy-nightly-2016-08-18-708b6af-sdk)

data.title: New preference for forcing fallback images on video sprites
data.body: Video was too taxing for some of our systems and we wanted to be able to fall back to the already defined backup images for movie sprites without deleting the original file paths.

data.title: Spacebar not recognized when inputing text using the Google Keyboard application [Android]
data.body:
Android version: 6.0.1

Model: Samsung Galaxy S6

Keyboard application: Google Keyboard

I am playing a game, [SF-IO](https://github.com/sonejostudios/SF-IO), built with RenPy on my Android phone (S6). When inputing text using the Google Keyboard application the space key does not get recognized by the game, and the resulting text appears without any whitespace.

Example: When entering my name if I type the text "Bryan Matsuo" the resulting text is "BryanMatsuo".

When using Samsung's default keyboard application, Samsung Keyboard, whitespace inputs correctly. This is unfortunate because Google Keyboard has proven superior for multi-lingual text input in other applications.

Let me know if you need additional information.

data.title: config.keymap 'viewport' doesn't work depending on mouse cursor
data.body:
I implemented the following:

```
config.keymap['viewport_up'].extend(['K_PAGEUP', 'repeat_K_PAGEUP'])
config.keymap['viewport_down'].extend(['K_PAGEDOWN', 'repeat_K_PAGEDOWN'])
```

But they couldn't work when mouse position is out of viewport.
When players are playing a game with keyboard or gamepad, mouse position is out of focus in most time . So it rarely works.

data.title: CTC advancement
data.body:
Tom since you heavily improving everything right now I wanna mention two of my feature requests at the "Click-to-Continue" indicator...

1.
Since the indicator is a indicator for "click-to-contiune" I wouldn't show it if in auto-forward or skip mode.
So the textbox should be updated as soon as you toggle afm or skip mode and the ctc is shown or hidden...

2.
If you use the "nestled" option then you might have some rare cases where the ctc indicator
jumps to the next line, but your actual text fits perfectly in "one" line. That's because of text.append(ctc).... For some it might be ok but for some other it might look silly or is not what they want. How about a third option where the ctc is kind of "nestled" but not part of the text itself. So the position is dynamically (it follows the text position) and could be also outside/offscreen of your textbox
definition...?

data.title: Nested showif statement ignores condition on parent
data.body:
Only condition on closest parent `showif` statement is used to decide if element should be rendered or not.

In this case label 2 is shown and label 4 is not shown: 

``` renpy
screen my_screen:
    showif True: #1
        label _("Test 2.") #2
        showif False: #3
            label _("Test 4.") #4
```

In this case label 2 is not shown and label 4 is **shown**: 

``` renpy
screen my_screen:
    showif False: #1
        label _("Test 2.") #2
        showif True: #3
            label _("Test 4.") #4
```

This behavior is not very intuitive. Probably `showif` should take parent `showif` status into account too.

data.title: Better feedback for bad icon format and other errors before gl test.
Mouse cursor hiding options seem slightly unintuitive
data.body:
I was trying to disable the mouse cursor hiding and could only find the config option which sets the timeout (config.mouse_hide_time). The documentation doesn't say how to stop hiding the cursor, only that it will be hidden. I thought that maybe setting it to 0 would stop it but it actually just hides it all the time (although you can still use the mouse in the game, even though you can't see it). So I spent a while searching for something like 
config.mouse_hide = True
...but couldn't find it. So I ended up searching the repository and found this in the launcher 
config.mouse_hide_time = 86400 \* 366
...which would seem to indicate that there is no way to stop hiding the cursor, you just set it high value a hope you don't reach it. Would it be possible to add 
config.mouse_hide
(defaulting to True) to give an option that makes it a bit more obvious on how to turn it off and isn't dependent on a timer? Feel feel to close this issue if you think it's unnecessary.

data.title: Reloading at the main menu brings us to the game menu.
_default_empty_window fails with dynamically referenced characters
data.body:
`_default_empty_window` fails with dynamically referenced characters.

Steps to reproduce:
- Define label with character passed as label parameter and use character object to say something in it:

``` renpy
label test_say(char):
    char "Hello"
    return
```
- In rpy file show window, call label, hide window:

``` renpy
define e = Character('Eileen')
window show None
call test_say(e)
window hide None # Exception here
```

Resulting exception:

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 295, in script
    window hide None
  File "renpy/common/000window.rpy", line 114, in execute_window_hide
    _window_hide(trans)
  File "renpy/common/000window.rpy", line 62, in _window_hide
    renpy.with_statement(None)
  File "renpy/common/00library.rpy", line 81, in _default_empty_window
    who = renpy.eval_who(who)
Exception: Sayer 'char' is not defined.

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\bootstrap.py", line 281, in bootstrap
    renpy.main.main()
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\main.py", line 463, in main
    run(restart)
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\main.py", line 139, in run
    renpy.execution.run_context(True)
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\execution.py", line 714, in run_context
    context.run()
  File "game/script.rpy", line 295, in script
    window hide None
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\ast.py", line 1689, in execute
    self.call("execute")
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\ast.py", line 1707, in call
    return renpy.statements.call(method, parsed, *args, **kwargs)
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\statements.py", line 144, in call
    return method(parsed, *args, **kwargs)
  File "renpy/common/000window.rpy", line 114, in execute_window_hide
    _window_hide(trans)
  File "renpy/common/000window.rpy", line 62, in _window_hide
    renpy.with_statement(None)
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\exports.py", line 1271, in with_statement
    return renpy.game.interface.do_with(trans, paired, clear=clear)
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\display\core.py", line 1921, in do_with
    self.with_none()
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\display\core.py", line 1939, in with_none
    self.show_window()
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\display\core.py", line 1913, in show_window
    renpy.config.empty_window()
  File "renpy/common/00library.rpy", line 81, in _default_empty_window
    who = renpy.eval_who(who)
  File "D:\Design\Platform\renpy-6.99.7-sdk\renpy\ast.py", line 500, in eval_who
    raise Exception("Sayer '%s' is not defined." % who.encode("utf-8"))
Exception: Sayer 'char' is not defined.

Windows-7-6.1.7601-SP1
Ren'Py 6.99.7.858
```
